name: Scenic Hotel Te Pania

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for one night as part of our honeymoon trip around NZ. The restaurant was being renovated during our stay so we weren't able to eat there in the evening, but overall we found the hotel to be comfortable, with good sized rooms, good standard of cleanliness and convenient off-road parking. There's great sea views from the rooms. The duty manager handled our check in and was very pleasant, and gave us complimentary drinks vouchers as a honeymoon gift. The hotel is on the main road through the town, so as previous reviewers have mentioned, there is some noise in the mornings from traffic travelling to the nearby port.
reviews.title: Pretty good

likes.liked: — Close to town centre - easy walking distance

reviews.title: Overpriced for what you get compared with most other places I have stayed at in
reviews.text: Excellent location very close to most of the Art Deco buildings; all rooms overlook the sea. The rooms are standard hotel rooms, but bigger than the European standard. There are free standing air conditioning units in the rooms, why oh why was central air conditioning not installed in a hotel that opened in 2003? We stayed a Saturday night in February when it was too hot to sleep without either the air conditioning on or the window open, but then it was too noisy to sleep well – either due to the noise of the air conditioning or kids larking about outside until about 5am.
We originally tried to book a small boutique hotel but this was full as it was the weekend of the Art Deco Festival in Napier.
reviews.title: A good hotel in a great location

reviews.text: We weren't sure what to expect from this hotel but found it to be very good. Our room was on level 5 so we had sea views, although the views from the lower rooms could be restricted by the trees. The room amenities were good. The aircon unit was very noisy so we chose not to use it and you do get some noise from the passing traffic.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I liked this place more than I expected - we tried to get in to the more highly rated hotels but they were either full or not prepared to accept a single night booking (it was New Year Day).
reviews.title: Fine, modern, well-located

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is modern, light and airy and the room well-proportioned. The views out onto the Pacific were a real treat. It is worth asking for a room on a higher storey, we were on the 5th floor which gave the better view.
reviews.title: Ok
Good design and location
reviews.text: We got the best price by booking through the hotel group web-site.
The restaurant was fine for the evening meal, though the breakfast was expensive for what it was.
reviews.title: Hotel is like sleeping on a racetrack
Noise spoils otherwise great hotel
reviews.text: Napier itself was very pleasant to stroll around, and well worth a visit. The Art Deco Centre on Tennyson Road offer guided tours, or for the independently minded self-guided maps are available (for foot and car).

We stayed at the Te Pania over Xmas New year whilst visiting family in Hawkes Bay. The hotel has a modern style, and all rooms have a view toward the sea, though the lower floors have their view obscured by the War Memorial and Ocean Spa pools. We were originally put in a room right next to the lifts, and asked to be moved as it was very noisy with people coming and going. Initially we were told we could not move, but when I asked if there were any rooms to upgrade to, they suddenly found one on the third floor, right at the end of the corridor, which are fabulous rooms as they have windows on two walls with a view down the Marine Parade. In the end they did not charge us extra, and we had a lovely stay. The location is excellent for roaming around Napier, and a good base for visiting Hawkes Bay vineyards. The Ocean Spa pools across the road are heated and great year round so pack your swimsuit. In all would recommend but get a room at least on level 3 (it goes to 5) and ask for one at the end of the corridor.
reviews.title: Good base for Hawkes Bay touring

reviews.text: Unusual looking hotel, but it works.
reviews.title: Beautiful place

reviews.text: We had a room overlooking the beach which is just over the road, lovely view to wake up to. It is also well within walking distance to see this amazing town of Art Deco buildings.
reviews.title: Loved the Te Pania

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Had the same experience as Warren Zevon. Booked at the Quality Inn Napier then went looking for somewhere else to stay immediately after arrival. Finding the Te Pania was such a relief. During the day, we went to Holy Bacon to buy some lunch meat for a picnic. They ended up giving us some free bacon because we were on our honeymoon, and told us to ask our hotel to cook it for us. So, that's what we did the next morning. The staff was so nice and threw-in some eggs and toast to go along with it. All the staff was very hospitable. Complete opposite from the Quality (HA!) Inn.
reviews.title: Agree with Warren

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This relatively new hotel is centrally located across from the water in Napier. The room, for the cost, is a good deal but everything is cheap so I predict it will be rather rundown in a few years. We got in late after a long day of wine tasting, and left early -- this is exactly the way you want to stay at this hotel. If you are looking for a comfortable room, a hotel that you would want to hang out at, this might not be a great choice.
reviews.title: Good stopover

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had booked in advance at the Quality inn. Big mistake - lasted 2 hours and left. Booked in here on spec. Slighly more expensive but vastly superior. Good location, nice room, excellent staff and a good restaurant. Napier / Hawkes bay is wonderful. Lunch at the mission recommended.
reviews.title: Welcome relief

reviews.text: This is an excellent hotel in the modern style, very clean and comfortable. The only downside in the rooms is the lack of inbuilt air-conditioning, a common deficiency in New Zealand. Instead each room has a large portable air-conditioner which rather gets in the way and is too noisy to use at night. The only evening meal we had in the restaurant was the barbeque, which was very good. The town of Napier is lovely and we wished that we could have stayed longer. We were a bit disconcerted, Napier being a seaside resort, to discover that the shops all close at 5pm.
reviews.title: Loved Napier

reviews.text: On the sea front (across a busy road). This hotel forms a semi-circle with all rooms boasting a sea front location. Restaurant seemed a little expensive, although there were plenty of alternatives. Continental Breakfast was $16.50 each. Swimming pool and gym were available at a price. Internet available in the rooms for 68c per minute. Newish hotel. This had been tagged with a 4 star rating locally. Small Reception area seemed affected by the windy conditions outside. West Indies Cricket team were staying there at the time of our visit. Napier is a busy port and industrial area, sand on the beach is darkened vocanic sand.
reviews.title: Busy road outside

description: Scenic Hotel Te Pania invites you to enjoy quality four-star plus, resort style, Napier accommodation and hospitality. From the moment you step into our spacious, light-filled lobby, you will experience our commitment to quality and customer service. The Hotel’s slender curved form echoes the shape of the bay, and guests enjoy sweeping views out over the water. Enjoy a Tequila Sunrise in our Exchange Brasserie whilst enjoying the passing Marine Parade show. Fresh and contemporary, Scenic Hotel Te Pania is just a short stroll from Napier’s main art deco architecture and little wonder why it is a firm favourite of all its valued guests!
